Ethereum Layer 2 with Privacy at its Core

About Us

Curve Labs is a team of design and development interventionists architecting distributed solutions for the future economy. We tackle systemic challenges of the Anthropocene by creating, combining, and integrating modular open-source technologies to form organizations more than the sum of their parts.

  • We are a design and development agency that works with organizational web3 primitives to create blockchain-native organizations, a.k.a. “DAOs.” Our clients include an activist coop, a decentralized finance application, and a sustainable development network.
  • We are social activists, creating and advocating for web3 solutions in regenerative finance, data sovereignty, and distributed energy systems. We aim to build holistic cyberphysical systems that simultaneously address social and ecological crises.
  • We are hands-on technologists who create infrastructural web3 building blocks, such as identity and reputation modules, smart wallets, and version control systems. We understand that these primitives are crucial for mass distributed technology adoption.

Altogether, Curve Labs is an exciting and diverse collaborative network of passionate domain experts navigating the razor edge of innovation. Join us.

What we’re looking for

  • 5-7 years of experience, with experience in a technical team lead role
  • You’re experienced in leading remotely-distributed software development teams
  • You have led an entire software development lifecycle of non-trivial public-facing web dApps

  • You have a keen awareness of the surrounding business ecosystem, particularly in relation to open-source development tools and technical advancement
  • Your tech stack: Web3-focused, with either back-end languages like Solidity or Rust, or front-end languages and frameworks such as Typescript or Angular. The specific language is less important than a demonstrated mastery of coding, computer science, and/or software engineering principles.

  • Steer multiple projects together with the project leads and give overall direction to the Front-End & Back-End teams (currently up to 15 individuals).

  • Choose suitable programming languages, frameworks, design patterns, and tools for product development

INCLUSION - We elevate diverse voices. We are most impactful when our organization and our work include people from varied backgrounds, opinions and perspectives. We are stronger together.

PARTICIPATION - We achieve our strongest impact when we work together to determine best practices surrounding governance and oversight. We are building an organizational model that leverages new ways to collaborate and enhance our collective ability to do good in the world.

About Us: At Gitcoin, our mission is to build and fund digital public goods. We empower communities of builders to connect and work together to create the future of the open web. As of August 2021, we have helped developers, designers, and creators of all types raise or earn >$35mm to fund their open-source ecosystems by enabling the community and institutions to fund each other with cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, or DAI.

In this role, you will work alongside fellow engineers, designers, and product managers as part of a dedicated product group to create new products, implement new features, and work to improve the performance, quality, and efficiency of our current products. This role includes implementing architecture improvements, writing code for both our Vue/JS/HTML/CSS frontend and Solidity contracts on EVM compatible networks, empathizing with our users and stakeholders, and collaborating to review, test, and deploy code with the rest of our engineering team.

What does it mean to work for a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO)?

  • You can work from anywhere! Our completely distributed team spans 5 continents.
  • Learn and grow with an experienced and talented team that values hard work and continuous improvement
  • Flexible time off (and a culture that takes it)
  • Operationally, it's more like running your own contractor/consultant business
  • Culturally, it's more like working for a non-profit because we are Mission-focused
  • There are elements of self management - power is shared horizontally, and you are your own boss

About You:

  • You are driven to create customer value. You can empathize with customers and our user base to understand their needs.
  • You have a bias towards action. You get things done. When you can't get them done, you communicate why and what you need to get unblocked.
  • You are persistent in the face of roadblocks. You take the initiative to fix issues before being assigned them.
  • You can identify problems/risks in architecture design and devise creative solutions/remediations.
  • You write automated tests and have an appreciation for dependable continuous integration/continuous delivery practices
  • You advocate for and understand how to incrementally refactor code to continually improve a codebase while ensuring that the systems are designed to scale.
  • You agree that a passionate, inclusive, collaborative team of missionaries always outperforms a loose group of individual mercenaries.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a software engineer at a tech company or startup.

Our Tech Stack Note: We don't expect candidates have every one of these skills before applying, however we expect them to be an expert in some, well versed in others and open to learning all.

  • Front End: HTML, CSS, JS, Vue, Webpack
  • Infrastructure: Linux, Docker, GCP, Terraform
  • Automated testing: Pytest, Cypress, TravisCI
  • Web3: Solidity, Ethereum, TheGraph, IPFS, cross-chain integrations, browser-based crypto wallets such as MetaMask

We believe that our team’s diversity is a strength. Ensuring our team is made up of people from all different backgrounds will lead to the strongest, most performant teams. We welcome applicants from any and all backgrounds.

I am an experienced engineer but I haven’t worked with Web3, crypto, or DeFi before... should I apply? Yes! This is a new and growing space. If you are passionate about learning new things and excited to dive into a new, expanding field, come grow with us!

Users of Livepeer can access instantly reliable and scalable video infrastructure while saving over 10x in cost compared to existing infrastructure providers.

As a blockchain based protocol which has been live on Ethereum since 2018, Livepeer is one of the first web3 networks to deliver real world value to an existing multi-billion dollar industry. We do this by using our open source, blockchain coordinated, p2p network to enable a worldwide community of hardware operators to run infrastructure for video streaming.   • Build and maintain software integrations to support hardware encoders/decoders such as Nvidia NVENC/NVDEC, AMD VCN/VCE and Intel QuickSync.

  • Conceptual understanding of public blockchains such as Ethereum.

  • Comfortable programming in C and Go.

If you are interested in applying for this position, please send an email containing your Github profile and/or LinkedIn to work@livepeer.org with the subject line: Senior Software Engineer - Video Transcoding.

1802513-senior-product-designer.title: Senior Product Designer
1802513-senior-product-designer.description:
At ConsenSys, we have a vision of a world where data sovereignty and financial well-being is accessible to every person and organization. We believe Ethereum and decentralized protocol technology is a more trustworthy and equitable foundation for how we create and share value across the web. On this trusted, open-source foundation, we can accelerate the world’s transition to a universally accessible network of distributed participants where transparency, security, and freedom are fundamental.

Our product suite, composed of Truffle, Infura, Quorum, Codefi, MetaMask, and Diligence, serves millions of users, supports billions of blockchain-based queries for our clients, and has handled billions of dollars in digital assets. As the leading Ethereum software company, ConsenSys enables developers, enterprises, and people worldwide to build next-generation applications, launch modern financial infrastructure, and access the decentralized web. To learn more about ConsenSys, and explore our products and solutions, visit http://consensys.net/.

Why join ConsenSys?

Remote first. You’ll be joining a team based all over the world. Providing the unique opportunity to work with people from across 6 continents.

Equity. We believe in ownership and want everyone to have a stake in our future success; that’s why you’ll receive equity when you join us.

Flexible working arrangements. With our global workforce, we have fine-tuned asynchronous working, which means we have a lot of flexibility in the structure of when we work and how we work together.

Competitive benefits.* We have a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to make sure we’re looking after you and what matters most.

*Continuous learning and opportunities.** We provide ongoing growth and development through on-the-job learning and the ConsenSys Advance Program, which includes full access to Coursera, bespoke and technical learning programs, and ConsenSys Academy, our world-class blockchain and Ethereum program.

Unlimited vacation/holidays. We value downtime to recharge and reset, ensuring everyone at ConsenSys has a work/life balance. In addition, company-wide, we participate in “zero productivity” days to take a break from work, shut down, and sit back and relax.

Recognized in the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem. Working at ConsenSys is a tremendous reference for your career. You’ll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that extends across the global crypto ecosystem.

About Customer Success team

The Customer Success team at ConsenSys is focused on exactly that: making our customers successful. We’re looking for people who will step towards a customer who is asking for help and respond with innovative and creative ideas to help them course-correct. If you value constructive customer engagement and want to define the future of Blockchain production operations, we’d love to hear from you.

What you’ll do

  • As a senior product designer, you will lead a collaborative design process from conception to launch: partner with small, global teams of engineers, product managers, and researchers to identify user needs, define product strategy, and create roadmaps.
  • Collaborate with UX Researchers, Product Owners and Engineering to ensure that the correct solution is designed and that it meets our users' needs.
  • Conduct research/product discovery.
  • Prototype and design at various levels of fidelity to communicate interaction and design ideas effectively
  • Actively give and solicit feedback from other designers to continually raise the bar for quality
  • Evangelize design and product thinking methodology
  • Fearlessly take on highly complex problem areas and then publish what you learn

Would be great if you brought this to the role

  • Your experience working as a product designer on agile teams (preferably from the B2C world), will guide you through the design process.
  • Your ability to create product vision and use data and research to provide product direction will allow for a more cohesive and planned experience.
  • Your expertise in complex-problem solving (evidenced in an online portfolio featuring E2E product design) will allow you to create modern UX designs which will delight our users.
  • Your experience in planning and conducting user-research - to improve the understanding of our users’ needs and wants.
  • Your understanding of customer experience and the relationship with marketing and product brand will create better communication with the marketing team.
  • Your communication skills and ability to articulate design decisions will create alignment within the team

Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans, and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic but fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role.

paperchain.content:

1681158-senior-data-engineer.title: senior data engineer
1681158-senior-data-engineer.description:
about the role

You will be responsible for building data products at Paperchain.

You'd be building on what's already in place, re-engineer if need be and setup our data pipeline for reliability and scale.

At the core of our product stack is the ability to ingest and price massive amounts of streaming data from Spotify, Apple, YouTube, etc. Without pricing we can't do instant payments and this role is geared towards iterating and improving our pricing model and data pipeline.

responsibilities

  • Help build and maintain the ETL data pipelines from external sources like Apple, Spotify, YouTube, Google into our data warehouse
  • Engineer our back-end to support a highly scalable distributed data platform
  • Build fast & robust microservice architecture and scale our stack (APIs, Events, Cache, Storage)
  • Automate and optimize manual data accumulation and analytical processes
  • Extend, optimize and maintain our current production ETL pipelines
  • Implement and deploy time-series based forecasting models
  • Write and optimize advanced SQL queries to analyze the media analytics and financial data
  • Extend, optimize and maintain some of our current backend systems
  • Iterate on and optimize our user data model, linking our users to our app stack, their content platforms (eg spotify) and their vendors (eg UnitedMasters)
  • All of your work should be optimized for interoperability with our product API stack
  • Develop data access policies that ensures our user data is accessed and handled in a secure and responsible manner
  • We're in a mode of hyper-growth and want to add to our team as soon as possible
  • If you are in the US / New York City you're welcome to join the CEO and work out of our co-work space

about you

  • Can write high-quality code and well-versed in TypeScript, Python and/or Go
  • Fluent in writing SQL queries
  • Comfortable working using Docker & Kubernetes
  • Well-versed in distributed databases (PostgreSQL) & systems
  • Have advanced knowledge of microservices architecture
  • Able to plan, strategize and implement quickly
  • Can communicate data trends effectively via verbal/nonverbal communication channels (GCP data studio, dashboards, graphs etc.)
  • Have 4+ years experience as a Back-End / Data Engineer or in a similar role

bonus

  • Familiar with Airflow or Data flow
  • Familiar with OLAP systems (like Druid or Clickhouse)
  • Solid understanding of machine learning
  • Understand how to set up a CI/CD pipelines (Google Cloud Build/Github Actions)
  • Personally interested in what's happening in the creator economy (NFTs, crypto, music and media streaming)
  • Passionate or interested in the online content space and web3 finance, in particular, exploring new business models by combining both

1145040-backend-engineer.description:
Tally (withtally.com) is hiring a backend & API engineer in the Americas time zone. We are a small team with a big goal: reinventing the way people collaborate on the internet by building tools for DAOs.

Our tools help run decentralized organizations in Web3 and DeFi protocols like Uniswap, ENS and Gitcoin on the Ethereum blockchain. Tally is a product- and engineering-driven startup. We obsess about improving the user experience. To get there, we need to deeply understand the power and limitations of blockchain tech today, and where it's going over the next few years.

We have a culture of teaching and learning from each other. We welcome and value contributions to code, product and process from all members of our team.

Our team is fully remote. We’re based up and down the Americas from Buenos Aires to New York City. Instead of having offices, we have a budget for travel. We do both team retreats and go to big crypto conferences to meet other people in the space and to keep up with all the cool stuff people are doing.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Building out an express api in typescript
  • Integrating with blockchain data and other APIs
  • Communicating about requirements and engineering tradeoffs to other members of the team
  • Helping product and design properly scope stories and understand engineering costs
  • Continuously improving internal processes, both API tooling and – more importantly – human processes
  • Reviewing and providing feedback on code written by your colleagues

  • Familiarity with blockchain concepts like transactions, mining, rollups and smart contracts If you aren’t familiar with this stuff, we’d love to teach you!

Benefits:

  • In the US, 401k match and healthcare insurance
  • Equity/stock options
  • Generous and flexible PTO policy
  • Learning budget for books and online classes
  • Home office budget

To apply, send us a short note about your interest in Tally and a resume!

web3api.name: Web3API
web3api.content:
The Universal Web3 Integration Standard

Web3API brings the ease of Web2 to Web3. It aims to make integrating Web3 protocols into apps seamless, without sacrificing decentralization. Web3API accomplishes this through a WASM standard & developer toolchain that streamlines Web3 protocol integrations into applications. All of the logic that used to be bundled into JavaScript SDKs (among other languages), is now within light-weight, secure, and portable WASM modules. Web3API is being built by a group of enthusiastic builders from all around the globe. We believe in an open and decentralized internet, and are coordinating this project entirely through a DAO to ensure these values are retained.
